intro: Basanacantha mucronata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
